intro: Bupleurum triradiatum var. alpinum, commonly known as Alpine Bupleurum, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils at high altitudes. Its slender stems are often branched, and it produces small, yellowish-green flowers in umbels. The leaves are pinnately compound, with finely divided leaflets that contribute to its delicate appearance.
